data.why:
Apache XML Framework An Apache module that processes requests from
    various clients (SOAP, XML-RPC, Browser, etc.), farms the requests
    (in session form) to designated conforming perl scripts, converts
    the response to appropriate format (SOAP, XML-RPC, XML, HTML) and
    returns it to client.

    Web authors divide their code into perl script and optional XSL
    file. The perl script returns a hashref, which is converted into an
    XML structure (XML, SOAP, XML-RPC, etc.) If the client expects an
    HTML response, the XML is transformed through the XSL associated
    with the script.
